data.text: One who assumes a false appearance; one who feigns to be what he is not, or to feel or believe what he does not actually feel or believe; especially, a false pretender to virtue or piety.

One who plays a part; especially, one who, for the purpose of winning approbation of favor, puts on a fair outside seeming; one who feigns to be other and better than he is; a false pretender to virtue or piety; one who simulates virtue or piety.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: a person who professes beliefs and opinions that he or she does not hold in order to conceal his or her real feelings or motives
